jobs.title: Research Scientist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Ataraxis AI

Ataraxis is an AI precision medicine company working at the intersection of multi-modal artificial intelligence and oncology. We develop and deploy AI-native tools to assist physicians in selecting the most optimal treatments for their patients.

Our mission is to change how cancer is treated and impact at least 50% of new cancer cases by 2030. Our first test for breast cancer patients was developed and evaluated in a validation study on over 8,000 patients from 15 international institutions. Ataraxis Breast was shown to improve the accuracy of gold standard tests by 30% and enable testing expansion to 100,000 new patients annually. At Ataraxis, you will have a unique opportunity to shape not only the future of our company, but also the future of healthcare.

At Ataraxis, you will join an exceptional team at the forefront of healthcare-focused AI research and deployment. As a frontier AI lab, we bring together leading AI researchers, medical doctors, and industry veterans. Our advisors include AI pioneers such as Yann LeCun and distinguished oncologists from top cancer research institutions, all united by the mission to redefine precision medicine.

Ataraxis has raised $24 million in funding, including a recent $20.4 million Series A round led by top venture capital funds such as AIX Ventures (Hugging Face, Perplexity), Thiel Capital, Founders Fund (OpenAI, SpaceX, Palantir, Oscar Health), and Obvious Ventures (Recursion). Our company was recently covered in an exclusive story in TechCrunch, "Not all cancer patients need chemo."

We are an AI-native company with a flat organizational structure, where every team member is empowered to actively contribute. Leadership roles are earned by those who demonstrate initiative and consistently deliver exceptional results. Strong work ethic and the ability to prioritize ruthlessly are essential.

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement novel machine learning models and methods for self-supervised learning, survival analysis, multi-modal learning, causal inference and interpretability.

  • Translate machine learning and statistics papers into production-ready code.

  • Build robust model evaluation frameworks and monitor model performance.

  • Disseminate the results by co-authoring research papers and abstracts.

  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of engineers and scientists. Co-mentor our team of research engineers.

Qualifications

  • PhD degree in machine learning or statistics.

  • Passion for research, attention to detail and ability to drive tasks to completion. Strong preference will be given to candidates with papers in A* conferences (e.g. ICML, ICLR, NeurIPS).

  • Excellent understanding of core machine learning concepts.

  • Excellent knowledge of the foundations of statistics, linear algebra, probability and machine learning.

  • Excellent skills in Python and PyTorch.

  • Experience in deep learning and at least one of {self-supervised learning, survival analysis, multi-modal learning, domain adaptation, causal inference, model interpretability, computational pathology}.

jobs.title: Research Engineer (Systems/Optimization)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Ataraxis AI

Ataraxis is an AI precision medicine company working at the intersection of multi-modal artificial intelligence and oncology. We develop and deploy AI-native tools to assist physicians in selecting the most optimal treatments for their patients.

Our mission is to change how cancer is treated and impact at least 50% of new cancer cases by 2030. Our first test for breast cancer patients was developed and evaluated in a validation study on over 8,000 patients from 15 international institutions. Ataraxis Breast was shown to improve the accuracy of gold standard tests by 30% and enable testing expansion to 100,000 new patients annually. At Ataraxis, you will have a unique opportunity to shape not only the future of our company, but also the future of healthcare.

At Ataraxis, you will join an exceptional team at the forefront of healthcare-focused AI research and deployment. As a frontier AI lab, we bring together leading AI researchers, medical doctors, and industry veterans. Our advisors include AI pioneers such as Yann LeCun and distinguished oncologists from top cancer research institutions, all united by the mission to redefine precision medicine.

Ataraxis has raised $24 million in funding, including a recent $20.4 million Series A round led by top venture capital funds such as AIX Ventures (Hugging Face, Perplexity), Thiel Capital, Founders Fund (OpenAI, SpaceX, Palantir, Oscar Health), and Obvious Ventures (Recursion). Our company was recently covered in an exclusive story in TechCrunch, "Not all cancer patients need chemo."

We are an AI-native company with a flat organizational structure, where every team member is empowered to actively contribute. Leadership roles are earned by those who demonstrate initiative and consistently deliver exceptional results. Strong work ethic and the ability to prioritize ruthlessly are essential.

Responsibilities

  • Implement novel machine learning models and methods for self-supervised learning, survival analysis, multi-modal learning, causality and interpretability.

  • Translate machine learning and statistics papers into production-ready code.

  • Build robust model evaluation frameworks and monitor model performance.

  • Optimize code to run efficiently on GPU clusters, with emphasis on speed and scalability.

  • Deploy machine learning models to the cloud in optimized inference pipelines.

  • Develop and maintain regression and unit tests to ensure high-quality code.

  • Disseminate the results by co-authoring research papers and abstracts.

  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of engineers and scientists.

Qualifications

  • BS/MS/PhD degree in computer science, machine learning or statistics.

  • Excellent understanding of core machine learning concepts.

  • Excellent knowledge of the foundations of statistics, linear algebra and probability.

  • Excellent skills in Python and PyTorch.

  • Excellent understanding of computer architecture, parallel training of AI models, and GPU optimization.

  • Experience in deep learning. Experience in at least one of {self-supervised learning, survival analysis, multi-modal learning, domain adaptation, causal inference, model interpretability, computational pathology} is a plus but is not critical.

  • Attention to detail and ability to drive tasks to completion.

  • Passion for research. Prior publications in A* conferences (e.g. ICML, ICLR, NeurIPS) are a plus but are not critical.

jobs.title: Research Engineer (Data Science)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Ataraxis AI

Ataraxis is an AI precision medicine company working at the intersection of multi-modal artificial intelligence and oncology. We develop and deploy AI-native tools to assist physicians in selecting the most optimal treatments for their patients.

Our mission is to change how cancer is treated and impact at least 50% of new cancer cases by 2030. Our first test for breast cancer patients was developed and evaluated in a validation study on over 8,000 patients from 15 international institutions. Ataraxis Breast was shown to improve the accuracy of gold standard tests by 30% and enable testing expansion to 100,000 new patients annually. At Ataraxis, you will have a unique opportunity to shape not only the future of our company, but also the future of healthcare.

At Ataraxis, you will join an exceptional team at the forefront of healthcare-focused AI research and deployment. As a frontier AI lab, we bring together leading AI researchers, medical doctors, and industry veterans. Our advisors include AI pioneers such as Yann LeCun and distinguished oncologists from top cancer research institutions, all united by the mission to redefine precision medicine.

Ataraxis has raised $24 million in funding, including a recent $20.4 million Series A round led by top venture capital funds such as AIX Ventures (Hugging Face, Perplexity), Thiel Capital, Founders Fund (OpenAI, SpaceX, Palantir, Oscar Health), and Obvious Ventures (Recursion). Our company was recently covered in an exclusive story in TechCrunch, "Not all cancer patients need chemo."

We are an AI-native company with a flat organizational structure, where every team member is empowered to actively contribute. Leadership roles are earned by those who demonstrate initiative and consistently deliver exceptional results. Strong work ethic and the ability to prioritize ruthlessly are essential.

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement novel machine learning models and methods for self-supervised learning, survival analysis, multi-modal learning, causal inference and interpretability.

  • Translate machine learning and statistics papers into production-ready code.

  • Develop pipelines for data preprocessing, integration, and quality assurance.

  • Maintain high standards of scientific documentation to ensure reproducibility and clarity in both internal reports and external publications.

  • Build robust model evaluation frameworks and monitor model performance.

  • Contribute to preparation of manuscripts for high-impact journals and conferences, including drafting methods, results, and figures.

  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of engineers and scientists.

Qualifications

  • BS/MS/PhD degree in computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, computational biology, or a related quantitative discipline.

  • Excellent understanding of core machine learning concepts.

  • Excellent knowledge of the foundations of linear algebra, probability, (bio)statistics and machine learning, with practical experience in applying them to data.

  • Experience in deep learning and at least one of {self-supervised learning, survival analysis, multi-modal learning, domain adaptation, causal inference, model interpretability, computational pathology}.

  • Excellent skills in Python, NumPy, Scikit-learn and Pandas.

  • Proficiency in data visualization and communicating complex results to both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • Prior experience in “research scientist”, “research engineer” or “data scientist” role.

  • Attention to detail and ability to drive tasks to completion.

  • Excellent scientific writing skills.

  • Passion for research. Prior publications in academic conferences or journals. Strong preference will be given to candidates with papers in A* conferences (e.g. ICML, ICLR, NeurIPS).

jobs.title: Salesforce Engineer/Business Systems Engineer (Part-Time)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Ataraxis AI

Ataraxis is an AI precision medicine company working at the intersection of multi-modal artificial intelligence and oncology. We develop and deploy AI-native tools to assist physicians in selecting the most optimal treatments for their patients.

Our mission is to change how cancer is treated and impact at least 50% of new cancer cases by 2030. Our first test for breast cancer patients was developed and evaluated in a validation study on over 8,000 patients from 15 international institutions. Ataraxis Breast was shown to improve the accuracy of gold standard tests by 30% and enable testing expansion to 100,000 new patients annually. At Ataraxis, you will have a unique opportunity to shape not only the future of our company, but also the future of healthcare.

At Ataraxis, you will join an exceptional team at the forefront of healthcare-focused AI research and deployment. As a frontier AI lab, we bring together leading AI researchers, medical doctors, and industry veterans. Our advisors include AI pioneers such as Yann LeCun and distinguished oncologists from top cancer research institutions, all united by the mission to redefine precision medicine.

Ataraxis has raised $24 million in funding, including a recent $20.4 million Series A round led by top venture capital funds such as AIX Ventures (Hugging Face, Perplexity), Thiel Capital, Founders Fund (OpenAI, SpaceX, Palantir, Oscar Health), and Obvious Ventures (Recursion). Our company was recently covered in an exclusive story in TechCrunch, "Not all cancer patients need chemo."

We are an AI-native company with a flat organizational structure, where every team member is empowered to actively contribute. Leadership roles are earned by those who demonstrate initiative and consistently deliver exceptional results. Strong work ethic and the ability to prioritize ruthlessly are essential.

Responsibilities

  • Implement and maintain all Salesforce workflows, automations, and integrations with other systems at Ataraxis.

  • Build dashboards, reports, and analytics for business and operations teams.

  • Import, clean, and map data from external systems into Salesforce.

  • Configure and maintain data models, custom objects, and API connections on Salesforce side.

  • Collaborate with operations, product, and leadership to translate business needs into system workflows.

Qualifications

  • 1–3 years of experience with Salesforce administration and engineering.

  • Strong hands-on skills in Salesforce Flow, Data Loader, and dashboard/report building.

  • Experience integrating data from other systems.

  • Comfort with light scripting (e.g., Python, JavaScript, or SQL) is a plus.

  • Ability to work independently and figure things out fast.

  • Execution-oriented.

  • Availability for a part-time engagement (between 5 and 20 hours/week).

jobs.title: General Application
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Ataraxis AI

Ataraxis is an AI precision medicine company working at the intersection of multi-modal artificial intelligence and oncology. We develop and deploy AI-native tools to assist physicians in selecting the most optimal treatments for their patients.

Our mission is to change how cancer is treated and impact at least 50% of new cancer cases by 2030. Our first test for breast cancer patients was developed and evaluated in a validation study on over 8,000 patients from 15 international institutions. Ataraxis Breast was shown to improve the accuracy of gold standard tests by 30% and enable testing expansion to 100,000 new patients annually. At Ataraxis, you will have a unique opportunity to shape not only the future of our company, but also the future of healthcare.

At Ataraxis, you will join an exceptional team at the forefront of healthcare-focused AI research and deployment. As a frontier AI lab, we bring together leading AI researchers, medical doctors, and industry veterans. Our advisors include AI pioneers such as Yann LeCun and distinguished oncologists from top cancer research institutions, all united by the mission to redefine precision medicine.

Ataraxis has raised $24 million in funding, including a recent $20.4 million Series A round led by top venture capital funds such as AIX Ventures (Hugging Face, Perplexity), Thiel Capital, Founders Fund (OpenAI, SpaceX, Palantir, Oscar Health), and Obvious Ventures (Recursion). Our company was recently covered in an exclusive story in TechCrunch, "Not all cancer patients need chemo."

We are an AI-native company with a flat organizational structure, where every team member is empowered to actively contribute. Leadership roles are earned by those who demonstrate initiative and consistently deliver exceptional results. Strong work ethic and the ability to prioritize ruthlessly are essential.

Don't see an open role that fits your expertise? We are always looking to connect with talented individuals who are passionate about transforming cancer treatment with AI.

Who We're Looking For

Ataraxis is a mission-driven and intensely working team that thrives on making an impact and delivering results, and we are looking for people at any stage of their career who:

  • Hands-On and Humble: You’re driven to be the best, and you know that greatness is built from the ground up. You believe in earning your impact, not delegating it.

  • Prioritize Outcomes Over Process: You're driven by results, not just ticking off boxes.

  • Excel Under Pressure: Challenges and deadlines motivate you to work harder and achieve more.

  • Are Self-Motivated and Relentless: You take ownership of your work, can figure things out on your own, and don't wait for direction to make things happen.

  • Have Elite Standards: You’re someone who consistently produces work at a level that sets the bar.

  • Pursue a Vision: You’re here to build something lasting, believing your contributions can reshape cancer care for good.

jobs.title: Oncology Specialist - Texas
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Ataraxis AI

Ataraxis is an AI precision medicine company working at the intersection of multi-modal artificial intelligence and oncology. We develop and deploy AI-native tools to assist physicians in selecting the most optimal treatments for their patients.

Our mission is to change how cancer is treated and impact at least 50% of new cancer cases by 2030. Our first test for breast cancer patients was developed and evaluated in a validation study on over 8,000 patients from 15 international institutions. Ataraxis Breast was shown to improve the accuracy of gold standard tests by 30% and enable testing expansion to 100,000 new patients annually. At Ataraxis, you will have a unique opportunity to shape not only the future of our company, but also the future of healthcare.

At Ataraxis, you will join an exceptional team at the forefront of healthcare-focused AI research and deployment. As a frontier AI lab, we bring together leading AI researchers, medical doctors, and industry veterans. Our advisors include AI pioneers such as Yann LeCun and distinguished oncologists from top cancer research institutions, all united by the mission to redefine precision medicine.

Ataraxis has raised $24 million in funding, including a recent $20.4 million Series A round led by top venture capital funds such as AIX Ventures (Hugging Face, Perplexity), Thiel Capital, Founders Fund (OpenAI, SpaceX, Palantir, Oscar Health), and Obvious Ventures (Recursion). Our company was recently covered in an exclusive story in TechCrunch, "Not all cancer patients need chemo."

We are an AI-native company with a flat organizational structure, where every team member is empowered to actively contribute. Leadership roles are earned by those who demonstrate initiative and consistently deliver exceptional results. Strong work ethic and the ability to prioritize ruthlessly are essential.

Responsibilities

  • Aggressively drive sales growth and market penetration of Ataraxis oncology products through direct sales to individual oncologists within your designated territory.

  • Prospecting new business and maintaining relationships.

Qualifications

  • Minimum 2 years of demonstrated high-performance sales experience in oncology, especially in breast cancer.

  • Proven track record of consistently exceeding sales quotas and demonstrated achievement through awards or recognition (e.g., President's Club, Rookie of the Year).

  • Passionate about AI and innovation in healthcare, driven to learn and effectively communicate AI-based diagnostic solutions.

  • Autonomous, capable of excelling independently in a hyper-growth start-up environment.

  • Ability to thrive in a highly competitive environment; demonstrates resilience, urgency, and focus on closing deals.
jobs.descriptionPlain:
ABOUT ATARAXIS AI

Ataraxis is an AI precision medicine company working at the intersection of multi-modal artificial intelligence and oncology. We develop and deploy AI-native tools to assist physicians in selecting the most optimal treatments for their patients.

Our mission is to change how cancer is treated and impact at least 50% of new cancer cases by 2030. Our first test for breast cancer patients was developed and evaluated in a validation study https://arxiv.org/abs/2410.21256 on over 8,000 patients from 15 international institutions. Ataraxis Breast was shown to improve the accuracy of gold standard tests by 30% and enable testing expansion to 100,000 new patients annually. At Ataraxis, you will have a unique opportunity to shape not only the future of our company, but also the future of healthcare.

At Ataraxis, you will join an exceptional team at the forefront of healthcare-focused AI research and deployment. As a frontier AI lab, we bring together leading AI researchers, medical doctors, and industry veterans. Our advisors include AI pioneers such as Yann LeCun and distinguished oncologists from top cancer research institutions, all united by the mission to redefine precision medicine.

Ataraxis has raised $24 million in funding, including a recent $20.4 million Series A round led by top venture capital funds such as AIX Ventures (Hugging Face, Perplexity), Thiel Capital, Founders Fund (OpenAI, SpaceX, Palantir, Oscar Health), and Obvious Ventures (Recursion). Our company was recently covered in an exclusive story in TechCrunch, "Not all cancer patients need chemo. https://techcrunch.com/2025/03/05/not-all-cancer-patients-need-chemo-ataraxis-ai-raised-20m-to-fix-that/"

We are an AI-native company with a flat organizational structure, where every team member is empowered to actively contribute. Leadership roles are earned by those who demonstrate initiative and consistently deliver exceptional results. Strong work ethic and the ability to prioritize ruthlessly are essential.


RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Aggressively drive sales growth and market penetration of Ataraxis oncology products through direct sales to individual oncologists within your designated territory.

 - Prospecting new business and maintaining relationships.


QUALIFICATIONS

 - Minimum 2 years of demonstrated high-performance sales experience in oncology, especially in breast cancer.

 - Proven track record of consistently exceeding sales quotas and demonstrated achievement through awards or recognition (e.g., President's Club, Rookie of the Year).

 - Passionate about AI and innovation in healthcare, driven to learn and effectively communicate AI-based diagnostic solutions.

 - Autonomous, capable of excelling independently in a hyper-growth start-up environment.

 - Ability to thrive in a highly competitive environment; demonstrates resilience, urgency, and focus on closing deals.

jobs.title: VP of Sales
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Ataraxis AI

Ataraxis is an AI precision medicine company working at the intersection of multi-modal artificial intelligence and oncology. We develop and deploy AI-native tools to assist physicians in selecting the most optimal treatments for their patients.

Our mission is to change how cancer is treated and impact at least 50% of new cancer cases by 2030. Our first test for breast cancer patients was developed and evaluated in a validation study on over 8,000 patients from 15 international institutions. Ataraxis Breast was shown to improve the accuracy of gold standard tests by 30% and enable testing expansion to 100,000 new patients annually. At Ataraxis, you will have a unique opportunity to shape not only the future of our company, but also the future of healthcare.

At Ataraxis, you will join an exceptional team at the forefront of healthcare-focused AI research and deployment. As a frontier AI lab, we bring together leading AI researchers, medical doctors, and industry veterans. Our advisors include AI pioneers such as Yann LeCun and distinguished oncologists from top cancer research institutions, all united by the mission to redefine precision medicine.

Ataraxis has raised $24 million in funding, including a recent $20.4 million Series A round led by top venture capital funds such as AIX Ventures (Hugging Face, Perplexity), Thiel Capital, Founders Fund (OpenAI, SpaceX, Palantir, Oscar Health), and Obvious Ventures (Recursion). Our company was recently covered in an exclusive story in TechCrunch, "Not all cancer patients need chemo."

We are an AI-native company with a flat organizational structure, where every team member is empowered to actively contribute. Leadership roles are earned by those who demonstrate initiative and consistently deliver exceptional results. Strong work ethic and the ability to prioritize ruthlessly are essential.

Responsibilities

  • Build and refine the early sales playbook for Ataraxis Breast, making it the standard of care platform for treatment selection in breast cancer in record time, replacing legacy genomic assays and creating commercial moat from future competitors.

  • You are expected to be in the field together with the sales team that reports to you, until Ataraxis grows and more structure and management is needed. You will be expected to act as a player-coach, with more focus on the "player" part in the beginning.

  • Design and implement a hiring plan that anticipates growth, building a world-class sales organization from the ground up.

  • Recruit, coach, and mentor high-performing sales professionals, instilling a culture of urgency, accountability, and excellence.

  • Develop and execute a territory strategy that supports sustainable scaling, including optimizing coverage models and regional priorities.

  • Partner cross-functionally with marketing, medical affairs, operations, and product to align go-to-market execution with company strategy.

  • Represent Ataraxis externally with oncologists, health systems, and partners as a trusted commercial leader.

Qualifications

  • Proven sales leadership in high-growth environments — track record of driving successful product launches and scaling volume/revenue from early commercialization to broad market adoption.

  • Strong background in diagnostics and/or pharmaceutical sales to oncologists. Experience in diagnostics required (at least 2 years).

  • Entrepreneurial mindset with unrelenting drive — thrives in fast-paced, high-growth environments without bureaucracy, comfortable building and operating within limited structure.

  • Strong preference for candidates with existing network of breast oncologists and surgeons.

  • Strong preference for candidates based in Texas or Florida.
